interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Bigfoot Vs. Zombies Review Date: 2016/07/08 Categories: Science Fiction, Suspense, Comedy, Horror Product Description: ['A scientist creates a toxic cocktail that slowly leaks into the local population, creating flesh-eating zombies - and only one creature of legend can stop the growing hordes of the undead.'] Average Rating: 2.6 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Mark Polonia'], 'Producers': ['Rob Hauschild']} Review Text: I have seen a lot of movies that some would call extraordinarily bad. But alas, this one does not measure up to any of those. The spectacular Bigfoot gorilla suit...er...I mean, make-up, was outstanding. The zombies were obviously trained by the best acting coaches that Hollywood had to offer. Every "Errr" was pronounced with depth, every "Arrrg" was breathtakingly realistic. The last time I heard such agonizing sounds was when I slipped in my shower...

And the humans - well - they left me as speechless as the stumbling zombies. Even with minimal dialog and plots that kept me on the edge of my seat. This brought back memories of the time I was hiking on Kauai, and almost slipped off a cliff in the rainstorm. Meaning, I had no idea if I would live through the next devastating twist...

Bigfoot Vs. Zombies - a movie that I would highly recommend to anyone seeking a movie to watch while you're waiting for a meteor to strike the earth... Review Title: Incredible! Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

I get it, she didn't want to be there - like the rest of them - but her whining did get on my nerves after a while. I do hope the next movie will be better. Not As Good As The First {'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dennis Smith', "Terrence O'Hara", 'John Peter Kousakis', 'Tony Wharmby', 'Eric A. Pot', 'James Hanlon', 'James Whitmore Jr.', 'Diana Valentine', 'Frank Military', 'Tawnia McKiernan'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} Great season to a great show. Gets more into the relationship of Jo and Callen - won't say anymore than that. Also it builds on the Deeks relationship with Kensi. All in all a great season. Can't wait for Season 8! Excellent Season To Date {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['Norsk Bokmål'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Roar Uthaug'], 'Producers': ['Martin Sundland', 'Are Heidenstrøm'], 'Starring': ['Kristoffer Joner', 'Ane Dahl Torp', 'Jonas Hoff Oftebro']} Incredible movie! Yes it has subtitles but it's well worth the read. Hollywood should take notes on how to make a disaster movie without all the unbelievable nonsense they LOVE to add in...

Great movie with characters I actually cared about - wow - what a rarity these days in Hollywood. Awesome Movie Bigfoot Vs. Zombies Science Fiction, Suspense, Comedy, Horror ['A scientist creates a toxic cocktail that slowly leaks into the local population, creating flesh-eating zombies - and only one creature of legend can stop the growing hordes of the undead.'] {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Mark Polonia'], 'Producers': ['Rob Hauschild']} I have seen a lot of movies that some would call extraordinarily bad. profile:
The user maintains a strong preference for high-quality sci-fi and fantasy content, reflected in an impressive average rating of 4.9. They are discerning in their critiques, emphasizing story execution, character development, and emotional depth, while expressing a significant appreciation for character relationships and emotional authenticity. Their reviews highlight a continued aversion to excessive angst and negativity.

Recently, they engaged with a film that rated 5.0 for its grounded storytelling and character investment, reinforcing their desire for thoughtfully crafted narratives. Despite their discerning taste, they have shown a sense of humor about low-quality content, recently rating a movie with a 5.0 as a fun experience, emphasizing its entertainment value despite its poor production quality. This reflects their willingness to embrace creative narratives, even if they fall short in execution.

Their viewing habits stress sensitivity to advisories on violence and sexual content, alongside an inclination for accessibility features like subtitles and audio enhancements. Overall, the user is characterized as a critical yet enthusiastic viewer who seeks meaningful, emotionally resonant storytelling within the sci-fi and fantasy genres, while also enjoying humorous takes on lower-quality cinema at times. Their profile illustrates a balanced approach, valuing both high standards in narrative quality and the enjoyment of diverse viewing experiences.
